cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Creeping westward, then turning northwest and north toward the central Texas coast, with a slow crawl toward Matagorda Bay/Freeport and a subsequent northeast bend toward the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay–Freeport area on the central Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island and portions of southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely at Texas City late Sunday night through Tuesday, with a small chance of gusts approaching hurricane force if Beta strengthens near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Galveston Bay, producing moderate coastal flooding around docks, wharves, and low-lying storage areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches widespread with isolated totals up to 10 inches; high risk of flash and urban flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, large waves that could hamper vessel movements and damage exposed moorings; prolonged high water levels may delay drainage and recovery operations.
